articles.headline: Las Vegas Heat Breaks Records and Stuns Even the Forecasters
articles.snippet: A brutal heat wave that has gripped the West for days will shift eastward on the weekend, while much of sweltering Houston still lacks electricity.
articles.abstract: A brutal heat wave that has gripped the West for days will shift eastward on the weekend, while much of sweltering Houston still lacks electricity.
articles.lead_paragraph: For their anniversary road trip through the West, an escape from the humid misery of a Louisiana summer, Tyson and Adeline Maddox rented a glimmering convertible.
articles.byline: By Alan Blinder and Isabelle Taft

articles.headline: Biden Advisers Weigh How to Convince Him to End His Campaign
articles.snippet: Close allies of the president are developing a case for why he should step aside. But Mr. Biden is increasingly isolated.
articles.abstract: Close allies of the president are developing a case for why he should step aside. But Mr. Biden is increasingly isolated.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow the latest Biden news and election polls.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt, Katie Rogers and Peter Baker

articles.headline: Milwaukee’s Mayor, No Fan of Trump, Is Thrilled to Host His Party
articles.snippet: Cavalier Johnson, the Democratic mayor of Milwaukee, was one of the biggest cheerleaders for holding the Republican National Convention in the city.
articles.abstract: Cavalier Johnson, the Democratic mayor of Milwaukee, was one of the biggest cheerleaders for holding the Republican National Convention in the city.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mayor Cavalier Johnson was zipping in and out of Milwaukee’s City Hall this week, shuttling his children around town, meeting with his chief of staff and watching excitedly outside as tents sprang up near the site of the Republican National Convention.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman and Dan Simmons

articles.headline: How Biden Lost George Clooney and Hollywood
articles.snippet: The president’s stable of big donors, corralled in part by the movie mogul Jeffrey Katzenberg, has been devastated since his debate, with many closing their wallets.
articles.abstract: The president’s stable of big donors, corralled in part by the movie mogul Jeffrey Katzenberg, has been devastated since his debate, with many closing their wallets.
articles.byline: By Theodore Schleifer, Jacob Bernstein and Reid J. Epstein

articles.headline: Rescued Hostage Describes Months of Uncertainty and Terror in Gaza
articles.snippet: Andrey Kozlov was kept for six months in a family’s apartment by a Hamas operative who moonlighted as a journalist. Then Israeli commandos stormed in.
articles.abstract: Andrey Kozlov was kept for six months in a family’s apartment by a Hamas operative who moonlighted as a journalist. Then Israeli commandos stormed in.
articles.lead_paragraph: Idling away the hours in a darkened room in Gaza with two other hostages, Andrey Kozlov sometimes heard one of his captors on the other side of the door typing away on a laptop.

articles.headline: Martyr Inc.: How Trump Monetized a Persecution Narrative
articles.snippet: The candidate is blurring the lines between politics and business and turning his tribulations into cash — selling Bibles, clothing he wore in a mug shot and the promise of political salvation.
articles.abstract: The candidate is blurring the lines between politics and business and turning his tribulations into cash — selling Bibles, clothing he wore in a mug shot and the promise of political salvation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Former President Donald J. Trump hawks $59.99 Bibles with the same words he uses to win the votes of evangelical Christians. He sells swatches of the suit he wore in a mug shot while also raising money for his campaign by calling himself a “political prisoner.” He describes Truth Social, his refuge for those banned on other social media sites — and his best chance to substantially increase his wealth — as a bulwark against liberal companies out to silence Christians and conservatives.

articles.headline: Saudi Money Makes a Big Splash in Video Games
articles.snippet: For struggling American video game companies, Saudi Arabia’s investments in the industry have been hard to resist. Not all gamers are happy about it.
articles.abstract: For struggling American video game companies, Saudi Arabia’s investments in the industry have been hard to resist. Not all gamers are happy about it.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fans flooded through the streets of Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, by the thousands, kept cool by mist machines in the 110-degree heat. A 30-foot-tall replica gold trophy towered over onlookers at the city’s center. For a moment, covered in beams of brightly colored light, a country defined by tradition looked futuristic.
articles.byline: By Eli Tan and Katarina Premfors

articles.headline: Democrats Fear Safe Blue States Turning Purple as Biden Stays the Course
articles.snippet: Lingering worries about President Biden’s age could make Minnesota, New Hampshire, New Mexico and Virginia competitive, party operatives believe.
articles.abstract: Lingering worries about President Biden’s age could make Minnesota, New Hampshire, New Mexico and Virginia competitive, party operatives believe.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow the latest Biden news and election updates.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Nehamas and Kellen Browning
